Immigration Process After Acceptance

Congratulations on Your Acceptance!

Being accepted to a U.S. college is an exciting milestone. Now, it’s time to begin the immigration process so you can begin your journey. Follow these steps to ensure a smooth transition.

Step 1: Receive Your I-20 or DS-2019 Form

After accepting your offer, your college will send you an I-20 (for F-1 visas) or DS-2019 (for J-1 visas). These forms confirm your enrollment and are required to apply for a visa.

Step 2: Pay the SEVIS Fee

Pay the SEVIS (Student and Exchange Visitor Information System) fee using the information on your I-20 or DS-2019. Keep the receipt, as it is required for your visa interview.

Pay the SEVIS Fee Here

Step 3: Complete the DS-160 Form

Fill out the DS-160 online visa application form. This form collects your personal and travel information. Once completed, print the confirmation page for your visa interview.

Complete the DS-160 Form

Step 4: Schedule Your Visa Interview

Visit the U.S. Embassy or Consulate website in your country to schedule a visa interview. You’ll need your DS-160 confirmation, SEVIS receipt, and I-20 or DS-2019 for this step.

Step 5: Prepare for Your Visa Interview

  • Documents to Bring:
    • I-20 or DS-2019 form
    • DS-160 confirmation page
    • SEVIS fee receipt
    • Passport valid for at least six months beyond your stay
    • Admission letter
    • Financial documents (bank statements, scholarship letters, etc.)
  • Practice Common Questions: Be prepared to explain why you chose your college, your program of study, and your plans after graduation.

Step 6: Receive Your Visa

After a successful interview, you’ll receive your F-1 or J-1 visa. Review the details carefully to ensure accuracy.

Step 7: Book Your Travel

With your visa in hand, you can now book your flight to the U.S. Make sure to arrive before the start date listed on your I-20 or DS-2019 but no earlier than 30 days prior.

Step 8: Prepare for Arrival

Once you arrive in the U.S., present your I-20 or DS-2019, passport, and visa at the port of entry. Your passport will be stamped, and you’ll be admitted into the country.

EFK Scholars' Support

At EFK Scholars, we guide students through the immigration process, from completing forms to preparing for visa interviews. Let us help you make this journey stress-free.
